text:
GREAT BANK ROBBERY.

On Saturday some sensation was caused on its becoming known that a London bank had been robbed of a large sum in bills. It appears the bank is the London and Westminster bank, Lothbury. The bills had been remitted from the various country banks, for which the London and Westminster act as agents for the purpose of collecting in London, and after being tied up in a parcel were deposited in a case in the country manager's office. This apartment, situated on the left of the main entrance, and at the end of a corridor, is easily accessible to visitors, and it is supposed that while the officials and clerks were busily engaged on Wednesday afternoon, the 16th inst., in the settlement of stockbrokers' accounts, someone entered the country manager's office and abstracted the case of bills. They were all short bills, and their value has been exaggerated.
